headline.print_headline: Ad Age Redesigns in a Drive for Deeper Content
headline.seo: Advertising Age Redesigns Print Magazine, to Push Deeper Content
headline.main: In Digital World, Advertising Age Redesigns Print Publication

docs.snippet: The trade publication will soon introduce the most significant redesign in years to its weekly print product, redirecting its editorial focus in a digital world from breaking news to analysis....
docs.abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes Crain Communications' trade publication Advertising Age will introduce its most significant redesign in years to the weekly print product, redirecting its editorial focus in a digital world from breaking news to analysis.
docs.lead_paragraph: The trade publication will soon introduce the most significant redesign in years to its weekly print product, redirecting its editorial focus in a digital world from breaking news to analysis.

headline.seo: ‘Forbidden Broadway: Alive & Kicking!’: Shaping a Spoof

docs.snippet: Gerard Alessandrini is once again feasting on theatrical spoils, shaping his latest spoof, “Forbidden Broadway: Alive & Kicking!,” which anticipates fodder from shows opening in the fall....
docs.abstract: Gerard Alessandrini satirical revue Forbidden Broadway, which shut down in 2008 after 27 years of performances, is returning in a fresh edition, titled Forbidden Broadway: Alive & Kicking!; Alessandrini credits show's revival in part to wealth of new Broadway shows that can be mined for humorous material, as well as the audience's undying appetite for parody.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gerard Alessandrini is once again feasting on theatrical spoils, shaping his latest spoof, “Forbidden Broadway: Alive & Kicking!,” which anticipates fodder from shows opening in the fall.

headline.print_headline: A Conflicted Novice in the Shadow of the Guillotine
headline.seo: ‘Dialogues des Carmélites,’ by Dell’Arte Opera Ensemble
headline.main: A Conflicted Novice in the Shadow of the Guillotine

docs.snippet: Poulenc’s tragic 1957 work, “Dialogues des Carmélites,” was presented by Dell’Arte Opera company in repertory with “Carmen.”...
docs.abstract: Zachary Woolfe reviews Dell'Arte Opera Ensemble production of Poulenc opera Dialogues des Carmelites, directed by Victoria Crutchfield and starring Jennifer Moore.
docs.lead_paragraph: Poulenc’s tragic 1957 work, “Dialogues des Carmélites,” was presented by Dell’Arte Opera company in repertory with “Carmen.”

headline.seo: Political Conventions Can Learn From Reality Shows - Media Equation

docs.snippet: If political convention organizers acknowledged that they were putting on reality shows, television networks and viewers might be more inclined to watch....
docs.abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column opines that If political convention organizers admit they were putting on reality shows, television networks and viewers might be more inclined to watch; notes conventions feature all the preening of the Westminster Dog Show, but none of the drama or actual competition; says no matter how shiny the production, it will not satisfy growing public need for verisimilitude and authenticity.
docs.lead_paragraph: If political convention organizers acknowledged that they were putting on reality shows, television networks and viewers might be more inclined to watch.

headline.print_headline: The Way Forward: Recalling Forest Hills
headline.seo: Building Your Dream Open — Recalling Forest Hills
headline.main: The Way Forward: Recalling Forest Hills

docs.snippet: The United States Tennis Association has a grand opportunity to reclaim some of the dignity it squandered with luxury boxes at Arthur Ashe Stadium....
docs.abstract: George Vecsey article holds that planned changes for the United States Open should including paying homage to the gracious and distant past; recommends that the new Grandstand at the National Tennis Center be modeled after the old clubhouse at the hallowed West Side Tennis Club.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Tennis Association has a grand opportunity to reclaim some of the dignity it squandered with luxury boxes at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

headline.print_headline: Get to the Point, in Fewer Sets
headline.seo: Building Your Dream Open — Get to the Point, in Fewer Sets
headline.main: Get to the Point, in Fewer Sets

docs.snippet: With the increased physicality of the sport, best-of-five matches too often turn into seemingly interminable wars of attrition rather than the displays of finesse more befitting tennis....
docs.abstract: Ben Rothenberg article asserts that with the increased physicality of tennis, best-of-five matches too often turn into seemingly interminable wars of attrition rather than displays of finesse; calls for the United States Open and other Grand Slam events to do away with the best-of-five format and have all competitors play best-of-three matches.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the increased physicality of the sport, best-of-five matches too often turn into seemingly interminable wars of attrition rather than the displays of finesse more befitting tennis.

headline.print_headline: All Things Equal: Let’s Play Five
headline.seo: Building Your Dream Open — All Things Equal: Let’s Play Five
headline.main: All Things Equal: Let’s Play Five

docs.snippet: The United States Open established equal prize money for women in 1973, maybe it is time to let the women join the men in playing best-of-five matches....
docs.abstract: Ray Krueger article suggests that the women competing at the United States Open tennis tournament should play best-of-five matches, as the men do, rather than best-of-three.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Open established equal prize money for women in 1973, maybe it is time to let the women join the men in playing best-of-five matches.

headline.print_headline: Qualifying At a Location Near You
headline.seo: Building Your Dream U.S. Open — Qualifying at a Location Near You
headline.main: Qualifying at a Location Near You

docs.snippet: How about bringing the pop-up concept to Grand Slam tennis?...
docs.abstract: Gerald Marzorati article suggests holding United States Open qualifying matches at public tennis courts around New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: How about bringing the pop-up concept to Grand Slam tennis?

headline.print_headline: Cuomo Calls for Resignation Of Brooklyn Assemblyman
headline.seo: Cuomo Calls for Assemblyman Vito Lopez to Resign
headline.main: Cuomo Calls for Resignation of Brooklyn Assemblyman

docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo became the most prominent official to call for the resignation of Vito J. Lopez, who was censured after allegations of sexual harassment....
docs.abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo calls for the resignation of Vito J Lopez, a powerful Brooklyn assemblyman who was censured after allegations of sexual harassment; Lopez, who leads the Brooklyn Democratic Party, was accused of verbally harassing, groping and kissing two staff members, charges that the Assembly's ethics committee found credible.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo became the most prominent official to call for the resignation of Vito J. Lopez, who was censured after allegations of sexual harassment.
